cobblemon.species.pachyquag.name: Pachyquag
cobblemon.species.pachyquag.desc1: Since birth, this little Pokemon has an obsession with mud. It often makes sculptures of things it sees with said mud.
cobblemon.species.probog.name: Probog
cobblemon.species.probog.desc1: It's broad mouth enables it to eat its favorite swamp vegetation. Because of this, it cannot make sculptures anymore.
cobblemon.species.gooajah.name: Gooajah
cobblemon.species.gooajah.desc1: These Pokemon are masters at building with mud, being able to make shelters for it and its family with relative ease.
cobblemon.species.diplit.name: Diplit
cobblemon.species.diplit.desc1: It is rare to see a Diplit do anything other than eat. They communicate with their flexible tail.
cobblemon.species.camagma.name: Camagma
cobblemon.species.camagma.desc1: Camagma spend more time alone than with their siblings, but still communicate via bellows. They're very short tempered.
cobblemon.species.brachatoa.name: Brachatoa
cobblemon.species.brachatoa.desc1: Living near the base of volcanos, Brachatoa thrive under the intense heat. Their bellows can be heard for miles.
cobblemon.species.haiproto.name: Haiproto
cobblemon.species.haiproto.desc1: Believed to be one of the first Pokemon to evolve a backbone, they can form schools containing hundreds of individuals.
cobblemon.species.finwit.name: Finwit
cobblemon.species.finwit.desc1: Despite their evolutionary advantages, they're very dumb. They often bump into and eat everything.
cobblemon.species.dunklex.name: Dunklex
cobblemon.species.dunklex.desc1: Their jaws are strong enough to crush bedrock. Despite that, they're very affectionate to their trainers.
cobblemon.species.wombit.name: Wombit
cobblemon.species.wombit.desc1: Wombit are always hungry, eating everything in sight. They never eat their stick, and become anxious when it's missing.
cobblemon.species.gnawdon.name: Gnawdon
cobblemon.species.gnawdon.desc1: Due to living in the marshes of the Perdian Region, moss has grown on its coat. Their incisors can cut through any plant.
cobblemon.species.fuzzapiller.name: Fuzzapiller
cobblemon.species.fuzzapiller.desc1: The wooly fur that covers the neck of Fuzzapiller keeps it warm on cold nights. During night, its eyes glow red.
cobblemon.species.shagcoon.name: Shagcoon
cobblemon.species.shagcoon.desc1: To protect itself from predators, the fluff around it causes painful swelling when touched. It sits idley by until it evolves.
cobblemon.species.masomoth.name: Masomoth
cobblemon.species.masomoth.desc1: With its glowing eyes and wing patterns, many have mistaken this Pokemon for a different beast altogether.
cobblemon.species.crawny.name: Crawny
cobblemon.species.crawny.desc1: Its massive eyes allow it to see in all directions. It tends to stick near coral reefs.
cobblemon.species.cramber.name: Cramber
cobblemon.species.cramber.desc1: While preferring to stay in deep ocean trenches, once a year they come to the shallows to breed.
cobblemon.species.poldra.name: Poldra
cobblemon.species.poldra.desc1: Its long neck enables it to fish away from the crashing waves. Its favorite fish to catch are Devoho.
cobblemon.species.magmite.name: Magmite
cobblemon.species.magmite.desc1: Magmites are distantly related to Unova's Joltiks, with the former feasting on body heat than electricity.
cobblemon.species.tickiln.name: Tickiln
cobblemon.species.tickiln.desc1: When a Tickiln finds a host, it stays there for life. The heat it consumes creates explosion-like sounds as it digests.
cobblemon.species.fleava.name: Fleava
cobblemon.species.fleava.desc1: Fleava are far more active than Tickilns, hopping between various hosts at alarming speeds.
cobblemon.species.driby.name: Driby
cobblemon.species.driby.desc1: Being highly playful, they often try to get other species to play with them in the tar pits they grow up in.
cobblemon.species.gorgoop.name: Gorgoop
cobblemon.species.gorgoop.desc1: Gorgoops have become more reclusive, constantly trying to improve their singing. Their tendrels are highly uncoordinated.
cobblemon.species.calybrea.name: Calybrea
cobblemon.species.calybrea.desc1: They are masters at mimicking voices, using this to lure prey to their tar pits. This even includes humans.
cobblemon.species.copint.name: Copint
cobblemon.species.copint.desc1: Copint were recreated via fragmentary DNA from a fossil. It is unlikely this was the Pokemons original form.
cobblemon.species.clonaw.name: Clonaw
cobblemon.species.clonaw.desc1: Due to its fragmentary origins, much of its DNA is from other Pokemon and is highly unstable because of it.
cobblemon.species.bellicate.name: Bellicate
cobblemon.species.bellicate.desc1: The effects of its cloning origins have caused Bellicate to act vary aggressively toward others, even their own trainers.
cobblemon.species.flufling.name: Flufling
cobblemon.species.flufling.desc1: This Pokemon constantly hops about in order to maintain its body temperature. If it stops, it could freeze.
cobblemon.species.woollea.name: Woollea
cobblemon.species.woollea.desc1: Woollea live in close-knit groups, communicating via clicks and whistles in the tundra forests they reside in.
cobblemon.species.foliqi.name: Foli-Qi
cobblemon.species.foliqi.desc1: Its paper thin wings are not used to flying as of yet, so Foli-Qi often decorate themselves by folding parts of their feathers.
cobblemon.species.yigami.name: Yi-gami
cobblemon.species.yigami.desc1: Rather than flying, this Pokemon glides. In modern times, they often steal paper from books to put onto themselves.
cobblemon.species.drakeon.name: Drakeon
cobblemon.species.drakeon.desc1: This ancient evolution of Eevee was thought to have disappeared ages ago, yet in the Hatzen Islands it remains.
cobblemon.species.chiteon.name: Chiteon
cobblemon.species.chiteon.desc1: Chiteon are very social, forming groups of up to 10 individuals. This Pokemon cannot be found anywhere else but the Hatzen Islands.
cobblemon.ability.toxicvoice.desc: Any sound move have a 30% chance to poison.
